title: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content:
If you have a look at the [url=http://wiki.commanderkeen.org/Keen4_Levels]Keen 4 level page[/url], you can see it has a link to a page for each level.

I would like to do the same for Keen 1, 2 and 3, however as far as I'm aware none of these levels have names. Keen 2 has some writing on the Vorticon Mothership which may work as level names, and most (all?) Keen 3 levels have a large sign at the start which could also be used as a level name, but what about Keen 1?

Any thoughts on the best way of doing this?

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content: CC314's [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/maps/maps-k1.html]Keen 1 Level Map[/url] page has names for all of the levels. I'm not sure where they came from or if they're official or not, but maybe you could just use those names in the Wiki.

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content: some levels in keen 3 have names in sga[url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content: Okay then, I'll use those names for Keen 1.  Does anyone know what the Keen 2 level "RC" stands for?  Are the [url=http://wiki.commanderkeen.org/Vorticon_Mothership]other level names[/url] correct?

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content:
I think RC stands for 'Reactor Core' because of the nuke symbol, and the energy cells at the bottom.

---Freeyorp

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content:
Indeed, sounds good to me. They're all in SGA on the map. Keen 1 mentions the Ice city, Pogo shrine and Vorticon commander's castle, so I guess there are quite a few names running about.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content: Righto then.  I'll put a list of the Keen 1 levels in the [[Mars]] article (unless someone else beats me to it, hint hint) in a similar style to the [[Vorticon Mothership]] article - then once people are happy with those names I'll start creating pages for them and linking in the level graphics.

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content:
Has anyone put up the butler and tank bot articles yet?
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content:
I'll take your contributions to those articles as a "yes" [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

I've put an updated list of the levels on the [url=http://wiki.commanderkeen.org/Vorticon_Mothership]Vorticon Mothership[/url] (Keen 2) and [url=http://wiki.commanderkeen.org/Vorticon_VI]Vorticon VI[/url] (Keen 3) pages (still have to do Mars), so in the meantime please have a look there and see what you think. There are some proposed names as not all levels have official designations, so if you have anything against the proposed names please leave a comment on the relevant discussion page.

title: Re: Wiki - level names for the Vorticons series?
content:
I thought it was Hal's kitchen...
